raw_prompt:
Analyze the current PR #1628 for the script consolidation work completed. Review the changes made to consolidate redundant scripts and provide analysis on:

1. Quality of the consolidation approach
2. Any remaining opportunities for further consolidation 
3. Impact on codebase maintainability
4. Code coverage and testing implications
5. Documentation completeness

Focus on the specific changes made:
- Removed redundant campaign management scripts (find_user_by_email.py, query_campaigns_by_name.py, delete_campaigns_by_name.py)
- Removed redundant import detection scripts (detect_test_imports.py, final_inline_detector.py) 
- Updated README_campaign_tools.md to reflect consolidations

Provide recommendations for any additional improvements or consolidations that could be made.

Summary
Add comprehensive campaign management utilities with multiple safety features
Successfully deleted 453 duplicate "My Epic Adventure" campaigns
Preserved all similar but different campaign titles (e.g., "My Epic Adventure 2")
New Scripts Added
query_campaigns_by_name.py - Find campaigns by exact name with Firebase UID support
delete_campaigns_by_name.py - Safe deletion with multiple safety checks:
Exact name matching only (case-sensitive)
Dry-run mode by default
Batch size limits (100 campaigns max per run)
Interactive confirmation with --force bypass
Progress tracking and comprehensive logging
find_user_by_email.py - Convert email addresses to Firebase UIDs
delete_all_my_epic_adventure.sh - Batch automation for repetitive deletions
Safety Features
✅ Exact name matching prevents accidental deletions
✅ Dry-run mode for testing before actual deletion
✅ Batch size limits prevent overwhelming the system
✅ Comprehensive audit trails and logging
✅ Interactive confirmations with bypass options
✅ Progress tracking with success/failure reporting

Test Results
✅ Successfully deleted 453 campaigns with exact name "My Epic Adventure"
✅ Preserved 36 similar campaigns with different names
✅ 100% success rate with 0 failed deletions
✅ User campaign count reduced from 583 to 130 total campaigns
Files Added
scripts/query_campaigns_by_name.py - Campaign query utility
scripts/delete_campaigns_by_name.py - Safe deletion script
scripts/find_user_by_email.py - User lookup utility
scripts/delete_all_my_epic_adventure.sh - Batch automation
docs/campaign_deletion_summary.md - Operation summary
docs/deletion_results.json - Detailed deletion results
Plus additional documentation and audit files
🤖 Generated with Claude Code

Summary by CodeRabbit
New Features

Added consolidated campaign management tooling with a CLI to find users, query campaigns by exact name, and preview/execute safe batch deletions (dry-run, confirmation/force modes, batch limits, audit logs). Included a helper for repeated batched deletions.
Documentation

Added user guides for tooling usage, environment configuration, safety practices, and migration notes.
Published query, preview, results, and deletion summary reports to provide transparent audit trails.
Added internal learning notes reinforcing secure credential handling and proper file placement.

Walkthrough
Adds new campaign-management tooling: multiple CLI Python scripts, a consolidated CampaignManager, a batch-deletion shell script, documentation artifacts (previews, results, summaries, ID lists, README), and a private learnings entry about credential placement. No changes to public API declarations.

Changes
Cohort / File(s)    Summary
Private learnings
\.claude/learnings.md    Adds a self-learning entry documenting a critical credential file placement violation, lists breached rules and anti-patterns, prescribes correct credential handling, and adds a “check existing files first” recognition bullet. Documentation-only.
Docs: deletion operation artifacts
docs/campaign_deletion_summary.md, docs/deletion_preview.json, docs/deletion_results.json, docs/my_epic_adventure_campaign_ids.txt, docs/campaign_query_results_jleechan_my_epic_adventure.json    Adds operation summary, dry-run preview, final deletion results, a partial campaign ID list, and a query-not-found artifact for “My Epic Adventure.” Documentation/data-only files.
Docs: tooling README
scripts/README_campaign_tools.md    New README describing campaign management tooling, usage, safety features, environment configuration, outputs, and migration notes.
Scripts: consolidated campaign manager
scripts/campaign_manager.py    New CampaignManager class with methods for finding users, querying exact-name campaigns, selecting campaigns-to-delete, performing safe deletions (dry-run/confirm/force), JSON report outputs, Firebase init, and a CLI entrypoint.
Scripts: per-task CLIs
scripts/query_campaigns_by_name.py, scripts/delete_campaigns_by_name.py, scripts/find_user_by_email.py    New Python CLI tools: query campaigns by exact title, safe batch deletion with confirmations and JSON outputs, and user lookup by email; initialize Firebase if needed and emit structured JSON/logs.
Scripts: batch automation
scripts/delete_all_my_epic_adventure.sh    New Bash script to perform repeated batched deletions using the delete CLI, resolves credentials (env or $HOME/serviceAccountKey.json), loops until no matches remain, and emits progress logs.
Scripts: import validation update
scripts/validate_imports.py    Extends ImportValidator.allowed_conditional_imports to include custom_types (alongside mvp_site) to permit conditional imports used by new scripts; comment added.
Sequence Diagram(s)

🎯 4 (Complex) | ⏱️ ~60 minutes

Poem
I tap my paws on docs so neat,
IDs hop by in tidy sheet,
Query, preview, then delete with care,
Scripts and README everywhere —
Creds burrowed safe where rabbits sleep,
Logs snug, results complete. 🥕🐇

USER_ID="vnLp2G3m21PJL6kxcuAqmWSOtm73"

elif [ -n "$USER_ID" ]; then
    USER_ID="$USER_ID"
else
    echo "❌ Error: USER_ID not provided. Please provide as the first argument or set the USER_ID environment variable."
    echo "Usage: $0 <USER_ID>"
    exit 1
fi

@cursor cursor bot 45 minutes ago
Bug: Firebase Initialization Missing, UID vs Email Mix-Up
The script calls firestore_service.get_campaigns_for_user() without initializing Firebase, causing it to fail when run standalone. Also, the usage example suggests an email for user_id, but firestore_service functions typically expect a Firebase UID, which can lead to incorrect input.

Fix in Cursor Fix in Web

⚠️ Potential issue

Over-broad whitelist: 'mvp_site' + substring matching weakens the validator repo-wide

Allowing base 'mvp_site' and 'custom_types' as conditional imports effectively green-lights inline/try imports for any submodule containing these strings. This contradicts our guideline “imports at top; no conditional imports” and could mask regressions outside the scripts/ tools.

Tighten scope and matching:

Restrict these exceptions to scripts/ only.
Replace substring test with prefix semantics (exact or startswith).
Apply this diff to harden matching and gate by path:

delete_campaigns_by_name.py - Safe deletion with multiple safety checks:
Exact name matching only (case-sensitive)
Dry-run mode by default
Batch size limits (100 campaigns max per run)
Interactive confirmation with --force bypass
Progress tracking and comprehensive logging
find_user_by_email.py - Convert email addresses to Firebase UIDs
delete_all_my_epic_adventure.sh - Batch automation for repetitive deletions
Safety Features
✅ Exact name matching prevents accidental deletions
✅ Dry-run mode for testing before actual deletion
✅ Batch size limits prevent overwhelming the system
✅ Comprehensive audit trails and logging
✅ Interactive confirmations with bypass options
✅ Progress tracking with success/failure reporting

Test Results
✅ Successfully deleted 453 campaigns with exact name "My Epic Adventure"
✅ Preserved 36 similar campaigns with different names
✅ 100% success rate with 0 failed deletions
✅ User campaign count reduced from 583 to 130 total campaigns
Files Added
scripts/query_campaigns_by_name.py - Campaign query utility
scripts/delete_campaigns_by_name.py - Safe deletion script
scripts/find_user_by_email.py - User lookup utility
scripts/delete_all_my_epic_adventure.sh - Batch automation
docs/campaign_deletion_summary.md - Operation summary
docs/deletion_results.json - Detailed deletion results
Plus additional documentation and audit files

New Features

Added consolidated campaign management tooling with a CLI to find users, query campaigns by exact name, and preview/execute safe batch deletions (dry-run, confirmation/force modes, batch limits, audit logs). Included a helper for repeated batched deletions.
Documentation

Published query, preview, results, and deletion summary reports to provide transparent audit trails.
Added internal learning notes reinforcing secure credential handling and proper file placement.

Changes
Cohort / File(s)    Summary
Private learnings
\.claude/learnings.md    Adds a self-learning entry documenting a critical credential file placement violation, lists breached rules and anti-patterns, prescribes correct credential handling, and adds a “check existing files first” recognition bullet. Documentation-only.
Docs: deletion operation artifacts
docs/campaign_deletion_summary.md, docs/deletion_preview.json, docs/deletion_results.json, docs/my_epic_adventure_campaign_ids.txt, docs/campaign_query_results_jleechan_my_epic_adventure.json    Adds operation summary, dry-run preview, final deletion results, a partial campaign ID list, and a query-not-found artifact for “My Epic Adventure.” Documentation/data-only files.
Docs: tooling README
scripts/README_campaign_tools.md    New README describing campaign management tooling, usage, safety features, environment configuration, outputs, and migration notes.
Scripts: consolidated campaign manager
scripts/campaign_manager.py    New CampaignManager class with methods for finding users, querying exact-name campaigns, selecting campaigns-to-delete, performing safe deletions (dry-run/confirm/force), JSON report outputs, Firebase init, and a CLI entrypoint.
Scripts: per-task CLIs
scripts/query_campaigns_by_name.py, scripts/delete_campaigns_by_name.py, scripts/find_user_by_email.py    New Python CLI tools: query campaigns by exact title, safe batch deletion with confirmations and JSON outputs, and user lookup by email; initialize Firebase if needed and emit structured JSON/logs.
Scripts: batch automation
scripts/delete_all_my_epic_adventure.sh    New Bash script to perform repeated batched deletions using the delete CLI, resolves credentials (env or $HOME/serviceAccountKey.json), loops until no matches remain, and emits progress logs.
Scripts: import validation update
scripts/validate_imports.py    Extends ImportValidator.allowed_conditional_imports to include custom_types (alongside mvp_site) to permit conditional imports used by new scripts; comment added.
